msDesc.head: Sermons (mostly Geoffrey Babio, Ivo of Chartres, 'Jacobus Berengarius'); etc. Germany, s. xii.

msContents.summary: Mostly sermons of Geoffrey Babio (Schneyer II.150-9, listing this manuscript) with some by Ivo of Chartres, and some found in a collection attributed to a shadowy 'Jacobus Berengarius' (Schneyer III.877-86)

msItem.incipit: Dicite pusillanimes Aduentum domini fratres karissimi in tanta caligine
msItem.explicit: digne recipiatis regem apostolorum
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 1

msItem.incipit: Sanctam ac desiderabilem gloriosam ac singularem sollempnitatem
msItem.explicit: feliciter peruenire prestante
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 2

msItem.incipit: Apparuit benignitas Acquisierat sibi fratres karissimi genus humanum
msItem.explicit: ut dignetur nos recipere in celesti Ierusalem
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 3

msItem.incipit: Natalis dominici diem celebramus octauum in quo puer Ihesus a parentibus carnis sue carnale circumcisionis accepit sacramentum
msItem.explicit: preparata habeamus
msItem.note: Also in Beinecke Library, Marston MS. 135, fol. 158r-v.

msItem.incipit: Cum natus esset Cum creator omnium, fratres karissimi, formam serui
msItem.explicit: ad celestem curiam ascendere, qui uiuit et regnat
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 6

msItem.incipit: Postquam impleti sunt dies purgacionis Consuetudo erat fratres karissimi in ueteri lege
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 8

msItem.incipit: Fecit deus duo luminaria Sic uoluit fratres karissimi deus facere
msItem.explicit: ubi pax et gaudium et uita sunt per perducat, qui uiut et regnat
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 63

msItem.incipit: Adorna thalamum tuum Que est ista syon que thalamum suum precipitur adornare nisi sancta ecclesia
msItem.explicit: hostiam uiuam et immaculatam domino offeratis, per eundem.
msItem.note: Also in Marston MS. 135, fol. 25r-v; Shailor comparres Schneyer 8.605 (96) and 710 (58).

msItem.incipit: Audi Israel Ammonet nos dominus noster fratres karissimi per Iheremiam
msItem.explicit: gaudere cum eo in celis, per omnia secula seculorum amen
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 9

msItem.incipit: Si quis diligit me Consuetudo erat fratres karissimi in ueteri lege
msItem.explicit: possitis eum recipere, qui
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 10

msItem.incipit: Maria soror Moysi Vlciones fratres karissimi ueteris testamenti
msItem.explicit: introire gaudentes, per Christum
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 11

msItem.incipit: Nolite diligere mundum Est quidam spiritualis inimicus qui genus humanum excecat
msItem.explicit: penitencie inspiret, qui
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 12

msItem.incipit: Excutere de puluere Audite fratres karissimi quam dulciter quam effectuose
msItem.explicit: in terra uiuencium, qui uiuit
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 13

msItem.incipit: Dicite filie syon ecce rex tuus Mandat uobis rex celestis fratres karissimi
msItem.explicit: ad palmas Ierusalem, qui uiuit
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 15

msItem.incipit: Dominus noster Ihesus Christus ut sanctificaret Satis fratres karissimi audistis ordinem redempcionis nostre, sed dignum est
msItem.explicit: quod est magnum peccatum ut ait Gregorius in Dialogo
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 16

msItem.incipit: Sicut per Iheremiam prophetam, Preparamini contra Vos, fratres karissimi, congregati estis in domo Domini
msItem.explicit: recipiatis coronam uite
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 58

msItem.incipit: Labia sacerdotis custodiunt Audite fratres karissimi quantum thesaurum
msItem.explicit: redeatis ubi regnat dominus noster cum angelis suis, per omnia
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 72

msItem.incipit: Designauit dominus Ihesus alios discipulos Elegit fratres karissimi dominus in primitiua ecclesia
msItem.explicit: Vobis dicit dominus, Negociamini dum uenio
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 54

msItem.incipit: Scitote fratres karissimi quia uetus homo noster crucifixus est Letum nuncium affert uobis fratres karissimi apostolus
msItem.explicit: in uirtutibus resurgat, qui vivit
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 17

msItem.incipit: Estote imitatores mei Ammonet fratres karissimi apostolus ut sicut filii estis
msItem.explicit: per eam possitis consequi eternam, quod ipse
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 20

msItem.incipit: Hodie mater ecclesia filios suos in quibus detrimentum se sensisse cognoscit
msItem.explicit: saluus sit in die uestre resurrectionis
msItem.author: Ivo of Chartres
msItem.title: Sermo 13

msItem.incipit: Dominus noster Ihesus Christus in qua nocte tradebatur Inminente fratres karissimi passionis articulo
msItem.explicit: Qui ficte osculabitur inimicum socius Iude erit, qui ex dilectione Christi imitator. Deus autem pacis et dilectionis, pacem et dilectionem uobis tribuat.
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 19

msItem.incipit: Venite filii audite me, timorem domini docebo uos. Audite fratres quam dulci uoce
msItem.explicit: ubi in eternum gaudeatis, iuuante
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 23

msItem.incipit: Paulus apostolus ait Et enim pascha nostrum immolatus est Christus. Si igitur pascha Christus pensandum nobis est
msItem.explicit: pigri non sumus, adiuuat ipse quem amamus, Ihesus dominus noster
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 25

msItem.incipit: Diuina scriptura fratres karissimi nos aliquando
msItem.explicit: ab omni aduersitate nos defendat
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 26

msItem.incipit: Cum cetere festiuitates in recordacione rerum gestarum leticia spirituali fidelium mentes afficiant
msItem.explicit: gaudia toto desiderio transeamus.
msItem.author: Ivo of Chartres
msItem.title: Sermo 18

msItem.incipit: Qui uult hominem exhibere perfectum in christo reperiet omnia documenta uirtutum
msItem.explicit: coheredes autem christi.
msItem.author: Ivo of Chartres
msItem.title: Sermo 16

msItem.incipit: Hodie fratres uictoria Christi completa est, hodie triumphalia uexilla eius eriguntur, de spoliatione sua dolet cum principe Tartarus
msItem.explicit: ab imperatore completo suo agone coronam percipant
msItem.author: Ivo of Chartres
msItem.title: Sermo 19

msItem.incipit: Nemo uestrum dubitet karissimi duos esse redemptoris aduentus. Quorum primum precessisse alterum adhuc esse futurum certa fide cognoscimus
msItem.explicit: Beati enim misericordes quoniam ipsi misericordiam consequentur

msItem.incipit: Penitentiam agite appropinquabit enim regnum celorum. Euangelice tuba lectionis fratres karissimi modo auribus insonuit
msItem.explicit: dum potest inueniri misericordia, quia appropinquabit regnum celorum

msItem.incipit: Quanti meriti sit elemosinam facere sententiam domini in euangelio fratres aduertite. Date inquid elemosinam
msItem.explicit: Dimittite inquid et dimittetur uobis, date et dabitur uobis

msItem.incipit: Populus domini et oues pascue eius Duas confessiones esse bonas et deo acceptabiles sancta nobis fratres karissimi declarat auctoritas
msItem.explicit: Aperite mihi portas iusticie ingressus meas confitebor domino hec porta domini iusti intrabunt ...
msItem.note: 'Berengarius', Serm. 48 (Schneyer III.880) but ending differently, cf. Marston MS. 135 fols. 23r-24r.

msItem.incipit: Verbum crucis pereuntibus stulticia Fratres karissimi quia fidelibus locuturi
msItem.explicit: sit communiter salus, iuuante
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 28

msItem.incipit: Quis uestrum habebit amicum Modo sunt dies rogacionum
msItem.explicit: dei pietas commoueatur, qui uiuit
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 29

msItem.incipit: Confitemini ad alterutrum peccata uestra Cum in aliis fratres karissimi diebus ad confessionum
msItem.explicit: et metet, in presenti de mundanis, in futuro de celestibus, iuuante
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 30

msItem.incipit: Eleuatus est sol Hodie est fratres karissimi ascencionis domini iocunda festiuitas
msItem.explicit: simus remunerati, iuuante
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 31

msItem.incipit: Verbo domini celi firmati sunt Fratres karissimi scire debeatis quam et quanta
msItem.explicit: a uiciis mundemus ut mereamur suscipere, qui uiuit
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 32

msItem.incipit: Dum complerentur dies Pentecostes Congruum est satis fratres karissimi ut his diebus
msItem.explicit: de labore nostro remuneret, qui vivit
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 33

msItem.incipit: Vbi uenit plenitudo temporis Fratres karissimi magna dispensacione uoluit deus
msItem.explicit: fructuum copiam tribuat, auxiliante
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 34

msItem.incipit: Intrauit Ihesus quoddam castellum etc. In scriptura sacra res una et eadem multociens iunenitur diuersa significare
msItem.explicit: et nos participes simus meritis et precibus eius

msItem.incipit: Gaudent angeli laudantes benedicent dominum. Sicut regina nostra uirgo maria incomparabilis est ceteris uirginibus
msItem.explicit: si tales fuerimus de massa peccatorum assumpti sumus ...

msItem.incipit: Paradisi porta per Euam cunctis clausa est Sicut dolendum est de conditione temporalis miserie et dampnacionis eterne quam per Euam incurrimus
msItem.explicit: spiritus hominis saluus sit in die domini nostri Ihesus Christi

msItem.incipit: Duas Moyses tubas de argento constituit ut earum clangorem
msItem.explicit: ualeamus obtinere benedictionem ab Ysaac scilicet patre nostro Ihesu Christo
msItem.note: Also in Besancon, MS. 233, fol. 102r, and the 'Zdik homiliary', fols. 179v-180v (Jan Bistřický, 'K tak zvanému Zdíkovu homiliáři', Listy filologické / Folia philologica, Roč. 84, Čís. 1 (1961), pp. 66-84.

msItem.incipit: Ecce quam bonum Sic gratulatur dilectissimi
msItem.explicit: custodiat corda nostra in Christo
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 37

msItem.incipit: Cum egrederetur Loth Novisitis fratres karissimi quia Loth nepos Abrahe
msItem.explicit: nichil carius cum possidetur
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 36

msItem.incipit: Sic ait apostolus Paulus, Non est potestas nisi a deo Audite fratres karissimi quid apostolus domini clamat uobis
msItem.explicit: unum corpus efficiamur in secula seculorum amen
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 41

msItem.incipit: Nemo mittit uinum nouellum Dominus, fratres karissimi, loquens hominibus aliquando per figuras, aliquando per similitudinem, contra illos protulit qui in mundis uasis uerbum predicacionis recipiunt
msItem.explicit: Sperate ergo in domino ut dicatis cum psalmista, Domine deus meus in te

msItem.incipit: Conuertimini et agite penitentiam ab omnibus Audite fratres quante misericordie quante pacientie est redemptor noster
msItem.explicit: confirmet uos in omni opere ut spiritus sit saluus in die domini.
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 59

msItem.incipit: De ecclesie sacramentis locuturi prius ipsa sacramenta ponamus, postea uero quid significant
msItem.explicit: et indigentibus elemosinas largiatur
msItem.author: Bruno of Segni
msItem.title: De sacramentis ecclesiae

msItem.incipit: Sollempnem obseruantiam huius festiue diei a ritu gentilium supersticionum in religionem commutans suscepit ecclesia
msItem.explicit: liberum abire permisit. Dicit preterea huius uictorie memoriam
msItem.note: Breaks off incomplete at the end of fol. 72r; fol. 72v blank. Part of fol. 71v left blank due to parchment flaws.

msItem.incipit: Fundamenta eius in montibus Gloriosam fratres karissimi ciuitatem cepit ab inicio mundi dominus edificare
msItem.explicit: De quibus Dauid, Qui loquuntur pacem proximo suo mala autem in cordibus eorum
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 48

msItem.incipit: Salomon edificauit domum Omnia fratres karissimi antique facta leguntur sunt figura noue, et propter nos memorie commendata. Templum autem domini antiquitus
msItem.explicit: et preciosum confessorem Nicholaum ut eius meritis eternam patriam mereri possitis ....
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 49

msItem.incipit: Conuertimini et agite penitentiam ab omnibus Audite fratres karissimi quante misericordie quante pacientie est redemptor noster
msItem.explicit: confirmet uos in omni opere bono ut spiritus sit saluus in die domini.
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 59

msItem.incipit: Filii hominum usque quo graui corde Fratres karissimi, si filii dei estis, audite correctionem patris. Increpat nos dominus
msItem.explicit: facit deus pauperes, ut probet diujtes, alii dant se ipsos, ut martires, sicut sanctus simphorianus, et alii sancti quam plurimi feliciter
msItem.author: Geoffrey Babio
msItem.title: Serm. 61

msItem.incipit: Prima dedicacio templi domini a Salomone tempore autumpni, media a Zorobabel et Ihesu sacerdote tempore ueris
msItem.explicit: quia felicissima actio dicere ymnos regi conditori. Vnde illud, Beati qui habitant ...
msItem.note: Cf. PL 186.426-7 (Zacharias Chrysolopolitanus, Unum ex quattuor); also in British Library, Harl. MS. 3773, fols. 102r-103r.

msItem.incipit: Locus namque in quo dominus nasciturus erat Bethlehem antea uocatus est, quia futurum erat profecto ut uerus panis ibi
In hoc ewangelio tria sunt que nobis euangelista commendat, personam nascentis, ubi ait, Cum natus esset
msItem.explicit: siue tres magi cum tribus muneribus uenerunt quia gentilis populus ad fidem ueniens tres naturales uirtutes secum detulit, phisicam, ethicam, logicam id est naturalem, moralem et rationalem

msItem.rubric: Secundum Lucam ... Omelia venerabilis Bede presbiteri
msItem.incipit: In tempore illo. Eiciens Ihesus demonium Demoniacus iste qui apud Matheum
msItem.explicit: uel ad similitudinem Helie ignem deponeret
msItem.note: In fact a cento of Bede, On Luke III.4 (CCSL 120, pp. 231-2; PL 92.475-6) and Haimo of Auxerre, Hom. 42 (PL 118.255-6)

On fol. 84v, originally blank, are notes (s. xii/xiii) on (a) genuflection during the Ember Days except Pentecost, 'Legitur in ordine Romano quod in omni jejunio quatuor temporum nisi infra Penthecosten genua flectimus ... (cf. PL 151.1002) (b) the significance of the three masses said at Christmas.

supportDesc.extent:
i (parchment) + 84 + i (parchment) leaves. Fol. i is a medieval parchment endleaf (fol. i verso with 'De adventu domini', s. xv). Fol. 85 is a parchment endleaf of the date of the binding.
c. 190 c. 120 (Variable: many irregular edges)

layoutDesc.layout: Ruling in faint lead point, single column. Written space c. 155-60 c. 90-95 Fols. 1-72: 36 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Protogothic, s. xii, by several hands, above top line.

additions.p: Marginal additions, 15th century, fols. 50v, 82v; nota marks throughout in ink and red 'crayon'.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Archbp. Laud, c. 1638–1639

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael : identifiable by second folio as the first part of K XII P in cat. i (Mainz, StB I 577, fol. 257r ‘Sermones de tempore et sanctis', 2o fo ‘sensus hominum ut intelligerunt’) and the first part of K XI S a in cat. ii (Mainz, StB, Hs. I 576, fol. 155r, 2o fo ‘sensus hominum’). (The second part of K XII P / K XI S is now MS. Laud Misc. 488.)
William Laud, 1573–1645: ex-libris inscription of Archbp. Laud, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. 1r.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: Description by Matthew Holford and Alison Ray, Jan. 2024. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 345 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 40
